name: Kepler-222
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-222 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-222 is a star with 0.765 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.87 times its radius. It is located 2529.70 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-222 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-222 b

Kepler-222 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.94 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-222.

The mass of Kepler-222 b is 15.23 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-222 b is 3.16 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-222 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-222 c

Kepler-222 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.09 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-222.

The mass of Kepler-222 c is 38.28 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-222 c is 4.64 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-222 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-222 d

Kepler-222 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 28.08 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-222.

The mass of Kepler-222 d is 22.05 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-222 d is 3.69 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-222 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-222, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
